One-Factor SV¶

The considered SV model is that in Theory, i.e.,

\[\begin{split}ds(t) &= \mu s(t)dt + \sqrt{v(t)}s(t)dw^s(t),\\ dv(t) &= k(\theta - v(t))dt + \sigma_v\sqrt{v(t)}dw^v(t),\end{split}\]

which is also the baseline SV model of the package.

The computation of its moments has been explained in Program Design page.

API¶

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cmoment

Central Moments for One-Factor SV

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment

Moments for One-Factor SV

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov

Covariance for One-Factor SV

Moments for One-Factor SV

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.b_n(n1, n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

Represent \(b_2(\boldsymbol{n})\) in (7) in Poly

Parameters:

  • n1 – times of constant being selected.

  • n2 – times of \(v_{n-1}\) being selected.

  • n3 – times of \(eI_n\) being selected.

  • n4 – times of \(I_n\) being selected.

  • n5 – times of \(I_n^{*}\) being selected.

Returns:

a poly with attibute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.dm(l, par, wrt)¶

Partial derivative of moment w.r.t. parameter wrt

Parameters:

  • l – order of the moment.

  • par – parameters in dict.

  • wrt – with respect to.

Returns:

scalar of the partial derivative.

Return type:

float

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.dpoly(poly, wrt)¶

Partial derivative of central moment w.r.t. parameter wrt

Parameters:

  • poly – central moment represented by the poly whoes attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

  • wrt – with respect to.

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.m(l, par)¶

Moment in scalar

Parameters:

  • l – order of the central moment.

  • par – parameters in dict.

Returns:

scalar of the central moment.

Return type:

float

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.moment_comb(n, n1, n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

Moment for this combination in expansion of \(y_n^l\)

Parameters:

  • n – l in \(E[\overline{y}_{n}^l]\).

  • n1 – times of constant being selected.

  • n2 – times of \(v_{n-1}\) being selected.

  • n3 – times of \(eI_n\) being selected.

  • n4 – times of \(I_n\) being selected.

  • n5 – times of \(I_n^{*}\) being selected.

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’, ‘sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

Moment of \(y_n\) of order \(l\)

l – order of the moment.

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.moment.poly2num(poly, par)¶

Decode poly back to scalar

Parameters:

  • poly – poly to be decoded with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

  • par – parameters in dict.

Returns:

scalar of the poly.

Return type:

float

  • n4 – times of \(I_n\) being selected.

  • n5 – times of \(I_n^{*}\) being selected.

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cmoment.ve_eIII(n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

\(v_{n-1}^{n_2} e^{-n_3knh} eIII\)

Parameters:

  • n2 – \(n_2\) in above formula.

  • n3 – \(n_3\) in \(eIII\) which is \(E[eI_n^{n_3}I_n^{n_4}I_n^{*n_5}|v_{n-1}]\).

  • n4 – \(n_4\) in \(eIII\).

  • n5 – \(n_5\) in \(eIII\).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’theta’,’sigma_v’).

Return type:

Poly

Covariance for One-Factor SV

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.cov(l1, l2, par)¶

Covariance in scalar

Parameters:

  • l1 – l1 in \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\).

  • l2 – l2 in \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\).

  • par – parameters in dict.

Returns:

scalar of the covariance.

Return type:

float

Covariance \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\) in equation (8)

  • l1 – l1 in \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\).

  • l2 – l2 in \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\).

  • l2 – l2 in \(cov(y_n^{l_1},y_{n+1}^{l_2})\).

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.exp_vn(l)¶

Expand \(v_n^l\)

Parameters:

l – power

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-knh}eI_n’, ‘e^{-kh}’, ‘v_{n-1}’, ‘theta’, ‘sigma_v’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.moment_inner_comb(l1, m1, m2, m3, m4, m5, poly_eIv)¶

Moment for this inner combination in expansion of \(y_n^{l_1}\)

Parameters:

  • l1 – l1 in \(y_n^{l_1}\).

  • m1 – times of the constant in \(y_n\) being selected.

  • m2 – times of \(v_{n-1}\) being selected.

  • m3 – times of \(eI_{n}\) being selected.

  • m4 – times of \(I_{n}\) being selected.

  • m5 – times of \(I_{n}^{*}\) being selected.

  • poly_eIv – poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-knh}eI_n’,’e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’theta’,’sigma_v’).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’, ‘sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.moment_outer_comb(l2, n1, n2, n3, n4, n5, l1)¶

Moment for this outer combination in expansion of \(y_{n+1}^{l_2}\)

Parameters:

  • l2 – l2 in \(y_{n+1}^{l_2}\).

  • n1 – times of \(\theta\) being selected.

  • n2 – times of \(v_{n}\) being selected.

  • n3 – times of \(eI_{n+1}\) being selected.

  • n4 – times of \(I_{n+1}\) being selected.

  • n5 – times of \(I_{n+1}^{*}\) being selected.

  • l1 – l1 in \(y_{n}^{l_1}\).

Returns:

poly with attibute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’, ‘sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.moment_yy(l1, l2)¶

Moment \(E[y_n^{l_1}y_{n+1}^{l_2}]\) as in equation (9)

Parameters:

  • l1 – l1 in \(E[y_n^{l_1}y_{n+1}^{l_2}]\).

  • l2 – l2 in \(E[y_n^{l_1}y_{n+1}^{l_2}]\).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

hsvmoment.mdl_1fsv.cov.ve_eIII_vn(n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

Compute \(v_n^{n_2}e^{-n_3k(n+1)h} eIII\) and expand \(v_n\)

Parameters:

  • n2 – \(n_2\) in above equation.

  • n3 – \(n_3\) in \(eIII\) which is \(E[eI_{n+1}^{n_3}I_{n+1}^{n_4}I_{n+1}^{*n_5}|v_n]\).

  • n4 – \(n_4\) in \(eIII\).

  • n5 – \(n_5\) in \(eIII\).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-knh}eI_n’,’e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’theta’,’sigma_v’).

Return type:

Poly
